questions.question_text: When would a policy apply if the policy is set under Defend > Vulnerability > Images > Deployed?

choices.C: when the Image is built and when a Container is started form an Image
choices.A: when a serverless repository is scanned
choices.B: when a Container is started form an Image

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Should be B --> Vulnerability rules let you raise alerts or block deployments when deployed images have vulnerabilities.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
image build is scanned by CI policy 
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/22-12/prisma-cloud-compute-edition-admin/vulnerability_management/vuln_management_rules

Selected Answer: AB
x-redlock-auth --> Your JSON Web Token (JWT). Find your JWT in the response object of a successful login request.
Content-Type --> This header is required for requests that have request body parameters. The value is usually application/json, but see each request for specific requirements.

questions.question_text: Which two required request headers interface with Prisma Cloud API? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Enable the syslog option in the Console
choices.D: Enable the Splunk option in the Console.
choices.A: Enable the API settings for logging.
choices.B: Enable the CSV export in the Console.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C --> Log into Console. / Go to Manage > Alerts > Logging. / Configure Prisma Cloud to send audit event records to syslog, stdout and Prometheus.

questions.question_text:
An administrator has a requirement to ingest all Console and Defender logs to Splunk.

Which option will satisfy this requirement in Prisma Cloud Compute?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
When compliance rules are configured with block actions, they are enforced when a container is created. If the instantiated container violates your policy, Prisma Cloud prevents the container from being created.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin-compute/compliance/manage_compliance

Selected Answer: D
When compliance rules are configured with block actions, they are enforced when a container is created. If the instantiated container violates your policy, Prisma Cloud prevents the container from being created.

choices.B: Additional hosts will be prevented form starting.
choices.D: No containers will be allowed to start on that host.
choices.C: Containers on a host will be stopped.
choices.A: The host will be taken offline.

questions.question_text:
The security team wants to enable the “block” option under compliance checks on the host.

What effect will this option have if it violates the compliance check?

During an initial deployment of Prisma Cloud Compute, the customer sees vulnerabilities in their environment.

Which statement correctly describes the default vulnerability policy?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D.

Tested inside console.

choices.A: It blocks all containers that contain a vulnerability.
choices.B: It alerts on any container with more than three critical vulnerabilities.
choices.C: It blocks containers after 30 days if they contain a critical vulnerability.
choices.D: It alerts on all vulnerabilities, regardless of severity.
